title: Pete Townshend - South Bank Show - 1985
description:
Here is a nice bootleg. Check my account for more classic bootlegs.

Please enjoy, share with friends and please seed :)

Pete Townshend
Oct 1985
South Bank Show Documentary
57min 
PAL 
DVD

Source: ITV Broadcast recorded onto PANASONIC HIFI VHS VCR
Capture To
PC: Power Producer Gold

Picture: PAL 4:3 25fp/s 720x576 Around 8Mbps

Sound : MPEG 2.0 224kbps (HIFI Mono TV sound)

Menued and authored using TMPGenc



1. Introduction - Interview

2. History - PT timeline with reference to The Who 

3. White City - Location interview 

4. Horse's Neck - PT reads extracts from his book 

5. Rock Is Dead - Interview

6. Demos - That's Alright Mamma & After The Fire

7. Establishment - Interview

8. The Office - PT at Faber and Faber publishers

9. Dire Straits - Rehearsing "Going Home" at Wembley Arena

10. Faber And Faber - Presentation to publishers

11. White City - PT video diaries

12. Give Blood - Rehearsal performance with Deep End (Dave Gilmour on guitar)


Interviews by Melvyn Bragg

Lineage

PANASONIC HIFI VHS>>>PC>>>TMPGenc>>>YOU

This is from my original VHS 
recording made in 1985.


Pete Townshend is promoting the White City album but this documentary also 
features a demonstration by Pete of how he records at home 
(That's Alright Mamma and After The Fire).  

Also seen is PT rehearsing with 
Dire Straits and his own band Deep End featuring Dave Gilmour.


Attached is a cover I made last year.....It features a few screenshots
